titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1546c
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1546c

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

bʾstm b-ʿṯtr w-ʾlmqh

1.ʿAbdmaraʾhū, the [cl]ient of Dhū-Mi= 2.rrān, has dedicated to ʾĪlmuquh Thah= 3.wān and Thawr Baʿlum, lord of Ḥarwā= 4.num (this) statue which he had promised him for the well-being 5.of his son Saʿdʾawwām. And may 6.ʾĪlmuquh continue to grant his servant ʿAbdma= 7.raʾhū all the things which he might seek 8.of him. And may he grant him prosperity and 9.[g]ood fortune. And may he keep them safe [from] 10.any harm. By ʿAthtar and by ʾĪlmuqu[h].

ʿAbdmaraʾhū, the client of Dhū-Mi=
rrān, has dedicated to ʾĪlmuquh Thah=
wān and Thawr Baʿlum, lord of Ḥarwā=
num this statue which he had promised him for the well-being
of his son Saʿdʾawwām. And may
ʾĪlmuquh continue to grant his servant ʿAbdma=
raʾhū all the things which he might seek
of him. And may he grant him prosperity and
good fortune. And may he keep them safe from
any harm. By ʿAthtar and by ʾĪlmuquh.

any harm. By ʿAthtar and by ʾĪlmuquh.
